p: In the Mediterranean Basin, Lebanon falls within a recognized center of plant diversity that is considered a global hotspot, ranking third in the world both in plant diversity and endemism [ 1]. The present study focuses on Origanum ehrenbergii Boiss. (Lamiaceae), endemic to Lebanon, where it is known as “za’atar” and “hachichat al jorh” (wound herb). The herb is traditionally used as a cataplasm to stop bleeding and to heal all kinds of wounds [ 2].
